intro: Aspidium amesianum, commonly known as the European water fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Pteridaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are often submerged or floating in freshwater environments. The plant typically grows in shallow, still or slow-moving waters, such as ponds and marshes. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Aspidium amesianum plays an important ecological role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and small aquatic animals.
